alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 4:44AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Dale and Coffee Counties through 530 AM CST... At 444 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Antioch to near Andalusia. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elba, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, New Brockton, Ariton, Lee, Kinston, Mixons Crossroads, Curtis, Carl Folsom A/p, Camp Humming Hills, Clintonville, Roeton, Camp Alaflo Bsa, Phillips Crossroads, Arcus, Enterprise Municipal A/P, Hwy 231 Pea River Bridge and Alberton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for southeastern Alabama.
